means: 扯碎，撕碎( tatter的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: He fled wearing only a sarong and a tattered shirt.
sentence.Network_cn: 他逃走时只穿着莎笼和破旧的衬衫。

sentence.Network_en: A tattered flag hung from the roof of the burnt - out building.
sentence.Network_cn: 一面破旗挂在 烧毀 的建筑物房顶上.

GRE逆序_馆档网 ... cloistered 隐居的 tattered 衣衫褴褛的，破旧的 fettered 被拘束的，没自由的.
gruff的翻译查词例句词组大耳朵英语 ... guttate 滴状的, 有斑点的 ... tattered 破烂的, 褴褛的... aura 气氛, 气味.

list.abs: She wore tattered clothes , looking like a beggar ., 她穿着破烂的衣服 , 样子很像乞丐.
沪江博客 - make progress... ... without a hitch 非常顺利 in tatters 衣服破烂不堪，某事处于崩溃状态 moonlight 第二职业.

today , though , the idea that a of bureaucrats can engineer industrial progress seems as out-of-date as the tattered furniture in the office's dark hallways .然后，时至今日，一群官员能促进产业进步的想法显示已经过时了。一如办公大楼幽暗走廊内破烂的家具。
He persists in wearing his tattered overcoat ., 他坚持要穿他破烂的大衣.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'dressed in decoratively slashed or jagged clothing'): apparently originally from the noun tatter 'scrap of cloth' + -ed; later treated as a past participle

entry.def: If something such as clothing or a book is tattered, it is damaged or torn, especially because it has been used a lot over a long period of time.

example.ex: He fled wearing only a sarong and a tattered shirt.
example.tran: 他逃走时只穿着莎笼和破旧的衬衫。

entry.tran: 损坏严重的;一败涂地的
entry.def: If you describe something as tattered, you mean that it has been badly damaged or has failed completely.

example.ex: But, two-and-a-half years later, things haven't quite gone to plan and Stanley's dreams of fame and fortune lie tattered and torn.
example.tran: 但是，两年半之后，事情并未如愿发展，斯坦利追求名利的梦想完全破灭了。

example.ex: ...the last tattered remnants of a defeated army.

means.word_mean: 1. worn to shreds; or wearing torn or ragged clothing;

sentences.sentence: "our shattered dreams of peace and prosperity"
"a tattered remnant of its former strength"

sentences.cn: 他穿着一件破烂的外套。

sentences.en: Her tattered clothes in no way detracted from her beauty.
sentences.cn: 她的破衣烂衫丝毫没有影响她的美貌。
